meanings.definition: The art of creating three-dimensional forms or figures.
meanings.sent1: She learned sculpturing in art class and made a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent2: The sculpturing of the clay into a vase was a delicate process.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed sculpturing with playdough during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sculpturing the emotions of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sculpturing of the ice into intricate shapes amazed the spectators.

meanings.definition: The act of shaping or molding something into a particular form.
meanings.sent1: His sculpturing of the cake into a castle was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The sculpturing of the garden bushes into animals was whimsical.
meanings.sent3: The sculpturing of the clouds by the wind created interesting shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like sculpturing the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The sculpturing of the sand into a detailed castle was a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The process of carving or chiseling a material to create a sculpture.
meanings.sent1: The sculpturing of the marble into a statue took months.
meanings.sent2: His sculpturing of the wood into a bird was skillful.
meanings.sent3: The sculpturing of the cake into a unicorn was a sweet surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like sculpturing her future success.
meanings.sent5: The sculpturing of the metal into intricate designs required precision.
